content.description: Climb the obvious crack in the middle of the boulder, using good face holds to assist. Slightly smeary, holds will probably be very sandy.
content.protection: Landing is very soft and sandy, but a spotter is helpful.
content.location: Walk past all the boulders towards Double O Arch and turn around. You can't miss it- it's in the middle of the big boulder right in front of you.

content.description: Use crimps, sidepulls, and smears to head up the right side of the boulder to a large juggy hold and a nice edge, then top out via a crack. Starting on the arete instead of the face makes this a little harder and a little more fun.
content.protection: Very soft sandy landing, a spotter is nice.
content.location: Looking at the main boulder, there are several grooves crisscrossing the right side. Find a way up.

content.description: Start in a bit of a lieback on the lowest part of the crack, go hand over hand to a good right hand and throw for the top. The crux is getting the right hand cross to the good hold, it's fairly committal and there's an unfriendly-looking rock underneath.
content.protection: Landing is mostly sandy, but there's a large rock right under the route. Probably not worth bringing a pad, so bail by jumping off to the right in the sand, or have a spotter.
content.location: On the left side of the main boulder.

content.description: Step on the ledge and then jam your way up the lichen-y crack to a few okay face holds. The crux is just mental- the jams and holds are all there.
content.protection: Scary landing because of the ledge. There's less sand and another boulder in your landing area- best not to fall.
content.location: Walk around the back side of the main boulder- it's the obvious crack all the way up.
